pr_title: Fix transformed aggregated requests with missing trailers

timeline.bodyText:
Append trailers when the result of the reduction is a list of items.
Trailers should not be here, reasoning:

When trailers exist according to spec, the transfer encoding should be chunked
When the payload 'mayHaveTrailers==true' this flow is avoided
The calculateContentLength(item) method already checks instance type and throws exception if not buffer.
timeline.author: tkountis

timeline.bodyText: When a request/response is transformed then we have no info of the new payload, thus we revert safe-to-aggregate back to false.
timeline.author: tkountis

replies.bodyText: Discussed offline: users of aggregated API usually assume that the payload body always fits in memory. Transform functions are usually used for logging/metrics/decoration. If they have a use-case when transformation changes the size significantly, they have to handle it using streaming API.
replies.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.bodyText: Discussed offline: transformRawPayloadBody should not add trailers. For trailers, transform/transformRaw methods should be used. Also, users are responsible for consuming the original publisher when they apply transformations.
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy

timeline.message: Fix transformed aggregated requests with missing trailers

timeline.bodyText: Consider upgrading the copyright year for this file to 2018-2020
timeline.author: idelpivnitskiy
